channel.title: Peter MacKenzie Basaraba's Homepage on MacKenzieBasaraba.ca
channel.description: Recent content in Peter MacKenzie Basaraba's Homepage on MacKenzieBasaraba.ca

item.title: Desktops
item.author: peter@mackenziebasaraba.ca (Peter MacKenzie-Basaraba)
item.description: A compiled list of rices I’ve used over the years. I’ll be frank, as time goes on I care less about how my desktop looks and tend to cut down on styling it for practicality; Lord knows how frequently I’ll update this page.

item.title: Uses
item.author: peter@mackenziebasaraba.ca (Peter MacKenzie-Basaraba)
item.description:
Software

This is an overview of the software I use on my system regularly.

Objectives

blah blah blah, terminal, blah blah blah, vim

Base

Operating System/Distribution
I use Arch Linux; I made the switch in early 2024 after I moved from a desktop oriented workflow to predominantly working on an X220. It’s not as minimal as Gentoo; however, when your machine’s weak it’s a hell of a lot harder to rationalize building your system from source. Arch Linux seems to be the best middle ground between minimalism and quick maintenance.
Terminal
I’ve been using st since I moved away from Mint. To my knowledge, it’s the most minimal terminal you can get away with using. The beauty of Suckless software is the accessibility of their source code; chances are if there’s something you’re missing in the base install you can find a patch, or even better, write one yourself.
Shell
I’m not sure why I use Zsh ; it’s got all of the features of batch and plugin support for auto-completion and syntax colouring. Despite not being able to give a reason to why I use it I can recommend it on the basis that I’ve never ran into a problem with it.
Window Manager
dwm is the sole reason I moved away from Mint; I felt like I was watching wizards effortlessly snapping between ten different windows, all organized in absurd orientations—while they look neat there’s only a few layouts you need to patch in; I have yet to have wandered into a use case for the fibonacci layout.

Hardware

Desktop

Laptop(s)

Specs
CPU Intel i7-6700k 8@4.2Ghz
GPU Nividia GeForce RTX 2070
RAM 32025MiB
Storage I have so many hard drives in this thing, you don’t even know.

I lied, I dual boot Windows

As much as it pains me to admit it, I dual boot Windows 10 on an old hard-drive; this is for a few reasons, mainly my dependence on Adobe’s Creative Cloud suite for work. After nine years staring at After Effects it would be ludicrous to burden my clients with a lengthy readjustment period to Davinci Resolve or another Linux alternative… I’m also bloody cracked at Fortnite.

item.title: Simple Scripts
item.author: peter@mackenziebasaraba.ca (Peter MacKenzie-Basaraba)
item.description:
An assortment of simple scripts I run frequently. Feel free to use and rewrite them in any way you see fit.

bookmark

A simple script to log and retrieve URLs through dmenu.

item.title: Underage Gambling
item.author: peter@mackenziebasaraba.ca (Peter MacKenzie-Basaraba)
item.description: In the heat of the CS:GO gambling controversy, I blew eleven loons on a Dragon Doppler Skinhub case. I sat there on my 14th birthday, hypnotized, mouth agape as ludicrously expensive JPEG files danced across my screen; against all conceivable odds, I took home a Factory-New Dragon Lore.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.author: peter@mackenziebasaraba.ca (Peter MacKenzie-Basaraba)
item.description:
TLDR

This website is not logging any data, it does not use any scripts for tracking visitors, nor does it place any cookies on your computer.

This site and its owner do not collect any information on users. I have a thousand preventative measures to resist fingerprinting on my machine; it would be a bit hypocritical to turn around and collect user analytics. To be frank, beyond moral qualms, this is just an elaborate explanation to avoid admitting that I’m too much of a lazy bastard to configure and monitor a data system.
